intro: Carthamus humilis, commonly known as the dwarf safflower, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow, ray florets and a central disk of tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has linear, hairy leaves. It is cultivated for its seeds, which are used in cooking and traditional medicine. The flowers also attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
